file_content.text: I have a private call from Prime Minister Darbin Sull of Corellia. Please hold.
Hello? Oh, good to hear from you. I'm still proud of the work we did liberating Corellia from the rebellion.
The way I remember it, you sat back while I single-handedly ended the resistance.
I did all the work.
Ha! But please--let's be serious. I wouldn't want my secretary mistaking your jests for fact.
I trust you're enjoying your role in Corellian politics?
How's life treating you?
This prime minister gig comes with plenty of perks. A private estate, bottomless brandy reserves, you name it. I wanted to share the wealth.
Spit it out, Darbin.
Please accept this gift, a little something from my private collection. The least I could for your help in my promotion.
Excuse me, Prime Minister. Your next meeting....
Blast. Sorry, but planetary matters do come first. Good luck out there, and remember--you've always got a friend on Corellia.
Prime Minister Darbin Sull. I've spent years dreaming of this day. I won't forget your help.
I won't let you down. Imagine me--prime minister of Corellia!
That'll teach you to arrest a Corellian councilor. Who's the idiot now, Master Ramos?
Blasted Jedi. They've interfered with Corellian politics for the last time.
It's done, Darth Decimus. The Green Jedi Council's finished!
Excellent. Without their Jedi, the rebellion will crumble. Nothing will stop this miserable planet from joining the Empire. And we have you to thank.
No need to thank me.
That said, I won't let you escape without due reward.
My success was a given.
Clearly. And the best deserves worthy recognition.
Thank me later. Pay me now.
I agree, but not here. Your payment requires a personal touch.
Don't forget me, Darth Decimus. I played a big role--big enough for Corellia's new prime minister.
What's in store for Corellia?
I take over as prime minister, appointed for my loyal service to the Empire.
That was our agreement, wasn't it? I can see it now: Corellia rebuilding under the glorious leadership of Darbin Sull.
But freedom allows rebellion. And we've had enough of that. Perhaps we erase Corellia's would-be leader and rule with an iron fist.
Establish direct Imperial control over this planet. Its citizens will obey or face punishment.
Cage Corellia. [Kill Darbin]
And Darbin... people think you betrayed us. Letting you live would be a sign of weakness.
We could issue a press release, clear up the whole thing! Please... I'm supposed to be prime minister!
Good. We've worked too hard to let Corellia slip through our fingers.
Chain Corellia too tight and you risk more violence. But show them trust, put Darbin in charge and they'll peacefully bow to the Empire.
This planet deserves freedom.
Exactly! I'll show them the Empire's looking out for our best interests.
That's enough, Prime Minister Sull. Save your enthusiasm for the official ceremony.
This is a historic day, and it must be properly commemorated. Report to me at once so the Empire can give you the recognition you deserve.
There you are! I was afraid I wouldn't reach you in time.
My bruises weren't enough to trick the Republic. They accused me of being an Imperial spy... so I threw them something extra.
The Republic didn't buy my story. They accused me of being an Imperial agent... so I tossed them something extra.
I... mentioned your assault on the Memorial Garden. The Republic ate it up. They took me in... then sent a strike team your way.
You did what you had to do. I'll deal with it.
Thanks for the warning.
I'll make it up to you once Axial Park falls. Just be careful in there....
I should have known Corellia's esteemed councillor would betray me.
You double-crossing rat.
It's not like that! Telling them was the only way the Republic would buy my story!
Uh, that's my cue to go. I'm sure you'll pull through just fine.
That doesn't sound good.
It's not that bad. Maybe you'll even finish up before the strike team reaches you.
Or maybe not.
Listen--I've got to go. I'm sure you'll pull through just fine.
